meanings.definition: A person who talks boastfully or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The loud jawboner at the party wouldn't stop talking about his achievements.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known as a notorious jawboner during debates.
meanings.sent3: The jawboner at the office always has a story to tell, even if no one is listening.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a jawboner preceded him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The jawboner's words echoed in the room, leaving everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: To attempt to persuade or influence through forceful or boastful speech.
meanings.sent1: She tried to jawboner her way into getting a discount at the store.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson continued to jawboner the customer into buying the expensive product.
meanings.sent3: He jawbonered his friends into going on a spontaneous road trip.
meanings.sent4: The CEO jawbonered the investors into funding the new project.
meanings.sent5: The coach jawbonered the team into giving their best performance of the season.
